CAREER: Reliability and Security of Database and Web Applications

Database and web applications contain many critical faults, seriously undermining the security and reliability of our national information system infrastructures. Many such errors are introduced because of
these applications' dynamic and complex interactions with outside environments such as dynamically constructing queries to access a database. Thus, it is important to automatically enforce the correctness of these interactions, but no such technique or tool exists. Consequently, these applications are susceptible to serious failures and security threats. This project proposes a novel, systematic analysis framework to address this problem. With static analysis and runtime checking as its foundation, this framework will
offer a rigorous and comprehensive approach to validate and enforce large classes of high-level properties specific to database and web applications. The additional educational component includes the development of an interdisciplinary course integrating concepts from databases, programming languages, software engineering, and computer security to address the educational need of engineering robust database-intensive applications. This project is expected to impact both industry and academia. Analysis tools developed in the project
will be distributed for teaching, research, and experimental evaluation at other institutions and by industry. This project will also produce publicly available instructional materials including web sites and courseware that help people write more reliable and secure database and web applications, and serve as a clearing house for development tools such as the ones from this project.

POR.DRECONTENT:
For the duration of this project, we, the principal investigator and
graduate students, have investigated novel and practical techniques to
detect, analyze, and present defects and vulnerabilities in database
and web applications. In particular, we have developed rigorous,
general formalizations and effective techniques to deal with
high-level properties specific to database and web applications.

Our work has equipped application programmers with techniques and
tools to write reliable database and web application. The conducted
research and education activities have advanced our understanding
regarding vulnerability detection and prevention, helped to discover
many serious vulnerabilities in widely-deployed software, and trained
next generation computer scientists and engineers. More specifically,

- We have devised general and elegant formalizations for both
injection and access control vulnerabilities/attacks in web
applications.

- We have developed practical techniques to prevent injection attacks
at runtime and to detect injection vulnerabilities statically.

- We have developed novel, practical techniques to infer program
properties by monitoring a program's execution and to validate the
inferred properties by systematic program transformation and testing.

- We have developed effective testing and analysis techniques that
have been used to uncover serious vulnerabilities in popular
open-source web applications, thus significantly improving the
reliability and security of existing software and systems.

- We have substantially advanced our knowledge regarding software
reliability and security by formalizing common vulnerabilities and
inventing new detection techniques.

- We have disseminated our research results through publications in
top outlets such as highly-competitive conferences and premium
journals, public tool releases, and research exchanges.

- We have successfully trained the next generation computer scientists
(four PhD graduates) through graduate student mentoring and capable
software developers through undergraduate- and graduate-level
education.
